Submodules

src.trace_manager.Measurement module

class src.trace_manager.Measurement.Measurement(src: int, metric: any)[source]

Bases: object

Stores the metric of a single measurement

Parameters:

  • src (int) – The unique node id

  • metric (any) – This is the measurement metric, this could be latency, or bandwidth, or throughput etc.

src.trace_manager.NodeMeasurement module

class src.trace_manager.NodeMeasurement.NodeMeasurement(dpid, measurements: list[Measurement])[source]

Bases: object

Stores all the measurements of a single node

Parameters:

  • dpid (int) – The unique node id

  • measurements (list[Measurement]) – List of all the measurements of that particular node

src.trace_manager.TraceManager module

class src.trace_manager.TraceManager.TraceManager(path)[source]

Bases: ABC

This is a base class for trace extraction strategies. Each newly implemented trace extraction strategy should inherit from this class. Each new trace extraction strategy should implement :func: process_files and :func: get_next_state

Parameters:

path (str) – The path to the trace results folder.

abstract get_next_state() → list[Measurement][source]

Provides the next set of measurements for all the nodes in the network topology as a list of measurement objects where ith measurement in the list corresponds to the measurement of ith node in the network topology.

Returns:

Does not return anything

Return type:

None

abstract process_files() → None[source]

Processes all the trace results in the folder passed into the tracemanager and stores the results into a list of measurement objects.

Returns:

Does not return anything

Return type:

None

src.trace_manager.custom_latency_extractor module

class src.trace_manager.custom_latency_extractor.CustomLatencyExtractor(path)[source]

Bases: TraceManager

This is a custom latency extractor that extracts latency from the trace results. Note that the trace results must be ogranized in a certain way to utilize this strategy.

Parameters:

path (str) – The path to the trace measurements.

get_next_state() → list[Measurement] | None[source]

Provides the next set of measurements for all the nodes in the network topology as a list of measurement objects where ith measurement in the list corresponds to the measurement of ith node in the network topology.

Returns:

Does not return anything

Return type:

None

process_files()[source]

Processes all the trace results in the folder passed into the tracemanager and stores the results into a list of measurement objects.

Returns:

Does not return anything

Return type:

None
